posts.content:
CIRCLE YER WAGENS IS BACK!

For the third year running the Isle of Man VDub Club invites you to our VW event over the late May Bank Holiday weekend 2010 and we are looking forward to warmly welcoming old friends and new.

We have once again managed to get a great deal with the Isle of Man Steam Packet Company, and are able to offer an all-inclusive price of £209.00 for the weekend – BARGAIN HUH?

This is the total price for a vehicle and 2 passengers on the ferry, up to four nights camping and quality Manx hospitality and entertainment! Extra adults are £40.00 and kids are £26.00.

The Campsite is available for four nights from Thursday 27 May although the event officially starts on Friday 28 May.

For those who have been before, unfortunately the campsite at Cronk Aashen won’t be ready in time for us this year because of drainage work and reseeding to the fields over the winter, but we have found another great location just up the road in the heart of Kirk Michael village, with lovely views over the mountains, close to the beach, shops and not least, the pub!!!

The best option would be to travel to the Island from Belfast, Liverpool or Heysham on Thursday 27th, or from Liverpool/Heysham on Friday 28th. Return dates start from Sunday 30th to all three ports, but please phone the Steam Packet Holidays Team for all the details. You are welcome to extend your stay, add passengers, dogs etc to your booking. If you want to stay a little longer you will just need to arrange your own accommodation.

To book and for further info on travel etc. call the Steampacket Holidays team on +448457585833

If you would like to contact someone in the club please email secretary@iomvdubclub.com

Some other useful links:

http://www.cyw-iom.co.uk/ to keep you updated
http://www.steam-packet.com/ for timetables only
http://www.visitisleofman.com/for touristy stuff

http://www.facebook.com/?filter=app_2361831622#/group.php?gid=48257556903


Fancy dress theme Vikings
Bump for the nice island folk

More news on Circle Yer Wagens3 - we have just over 20 buses confirmed
from UK and Ireland and probably 10-15 local vans for the weekend so far

Weekend events include a three piece band in the bar Thursday night, with more entertainment from Trevor on Friday. Those of you there last year will remember how he can play pretty much anything you ask!
We thought we would do something that is closely linked with the Isle of
Man, so Saturday is Viking-themed - 'that's ...horned helmet types' day
with games, face-painting, food tent, races (wait and see!) all starting in the afternoon with our Viking fancy dress party finishing off the evening - music from Nigel and Roger in the Bar - Good times
For those that like the TT Races, the first practice starts in the evening,
so make sure you get back to the campsite in time before the road
closes or you will be locked out!!

Sunday will be our Drive- out and Tony Millichap has chosen a great route with a cracking finishing point, plenty for adults and kids to do etc.
More entertainment in the Bar on Sunday evening too
Keep up to date on our website, forum and on here & Facebook

cheers JoBug

adults tshirts are £10
Kids Tshirts are £6

Adults Mens sizes S M L XL XXL
Womens sizes S M L XL
Kids sizes 1/2yrs 3/4yrs 5/6yrs 7/8yrs 9/10yrs 11/12yrs

email me on chairman@iomvdubclub.com if you want to pre-order your tshirt now and to save disappointment on the weekend

Sounds fab, have just booked up, have done 37 TTs and love the place and the people and is that a great deal or what!!! It would cost more than that for 1 person and a motor bike. Know the location well brilliant place near the beach and great viewing for the races, great pub what else do you need, counting down the days see you all there Eddy @ Jackie.

eddy wrote:Sounds fab, have just booked up, have done 37 TTs and love the place and the people and is that a great deal or what!!! It would cost more than that for 1 person and a motor bike. Know the location well brilliant place near the beach and great viewing for the races, great pub what else do you need, counting down the days see you all there Eddy @ Jackie.




Was lovely to meet you both this weekend..............had a fantastic weekend........ loved ya bus will post up some photos this week.............have added erm to my FB site and will do the same on JK and our local site..........weekend went too quick though, back to work today and in the TT madness too mad busy for next couple of weeks now
